Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk openldap
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: openldap bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: OpenLDAP is an open-source suite of Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) applications and development tools. LDAP is a set of protocols used to access and maintain distributed directory information services over an IP network. The openldap packages contain configuration files, libraries, and documentation for OpenLDAP. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the ldap.conf(5) man page contained an incorrect description for the "TLS_REQCERT" parameter. This update corrects the "TLS_REQCERT" description in the man page. (BZ#1027613) Previously, due to a missing dependency on the "rpm" package, no certificates were generated in the /etc/openldap/certs/ directory under certain circumstances, and the directory was empty. This update adds the package dependency on "rpm" to openldap, and certificates are now correctly generated and present in /etc/openldap/certs/ after installing openldap. (BZ#1064251) Due to a typographical error, the "generate-server-cert.sh -h" script sometimes resulted in displaying an error instead of the usage description. The typographical error has been corrected, and openldap displays the usage description as expected. (BZ#1087490) Previously, a helper script did not remove a temporary file with security-relevant information. Consequently, it was possible to obtain the information, which could compromise the generated certificate. The underlying source code has been modified, and the temporary file is now removed as expected. (BZ#1103101) Due to a missing object-path information in the database front-end configuration, it was not possible to modify the front-end configuration by standard means. The object-path information has been added, and the user now can modify the front-end configuration by standard means. (BZ#1132094) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: This update adds a reference to the slapd documentation into the slapd service file. Now, the user can easily display relevant documentation when interacting with the slapd service running on a server from the command-line interface. (BZ#1087288) Support for the Transport Layer Security protocol version 1.1 (TLSv1.1) and later has been added in order to enable the latest secure transport. (BZ#1160468) Users of openldap are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
